PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7799 - Design Horizon the Easy Way with Help from the Horizon Sizing Estimator
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Take the complexity and mystery out of designing a VMware Horizon environment by learning the design methodology, concepts, and how-to approach for your project. Then see how the Horizon Sizing Estimator can be your assistant and aid you in designing and sizing a Horizon environment, maintaining current best practices and assisting with key design decisions. The team that develops the Horizon Sizing Estimator will show you how to try different scenarios and different design decisions. Get a fast view of the infrastructure, servers, and storage required and approach your Horizon deployment with confidence.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7562 - Cloud-Hosted Virtual Desktops and Apps: A Technical Deep Dive into Horizon Air
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) can be challenging, and customers often wonder how they can get the benefits of VDI without having to deploy and manage it. This is where DaaS or cloud-hosted virtual desktops and apps can definitely help. In this session, we will do a deep dive into VMware Horizon Air and give you a behind-the-scenes look at our architecture and best practices for integrating cloud-hosted virtual desktops and apps into your existing infrastructure (for example, Active Directory, networking, and files). We will also cover some great new capabilities in Horizon Air that are designed to make building, managing, and deploying virtual desktops and apps as simple as ABC (or close to it).

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7998 - The Latest in High-Performance Desktops and Applications with  Horizon 7, Blast Extreme Protocol,  and NVIDIA GRID vGPU
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Hear about the latest advances in 3D desktops and applications with VMware Horizon 7, Blast Extreme protocol, and NVIDIA GRID. Until now, delivering high-performance graphics workstations remotely was cost prohibitive and complicated to set up and deliver. With Horizon 7, Blast Extreme, and NVIDIA GRID vGPU, there has never been a better time to deliver high-performance 3D desktops and applications in a cost-effective manner that is simple to set up and deploy to bring your customers the security, performance, reliability, and collaboration needed to transform their business.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9392 - Expand Your Enterprise Mobility Strategy with VMware and the AirWatch Partners
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Transforming your organization for enterprise mobility success sometimes requires different solutions working together on one EMM platform with the broadest range of support. These solutions need to address and support a range of options for mobile security, application delivery, content management, mobility services and endpoint management. VMware ecosystem of AirWatch partner test, integrate and package joint solutions that deliver an extensive list of verified products and trusted solutions that enable mobility productivity, security and agility with the global leader in enterprise mobility management. Learn how VMware along with the AppConfig Community, the Mobile Security Alliance and our vast list of ecosystem partners deliver an integrated and trusted set of solution on one platform for mobility success.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8216 - Deep Dive: Deploying Office365 Applications on mobile devices with AirWatch
PresentationDetailsList.Description: For organizations moving to the cloud with Office 365, AirWatch can help drive user adoption and simplify deployment, security and management challenges. In this session, we’ll deep dive into management considerations and the methods to employ to secure Office 365 apps and data, drive adoption for end users, monitor device compliance, and enable easy access with single sign on.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8243R - Troubleshooting 101 for Horizon
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Have you run into a problem in your virtual desktop environment? Do you have a virtual machine that is not responding? Are users calling nonstop and interfering with your Halo sessions? Are you pulling out your hair? Learn the skills and tools you need to troubleshoot the top 10 issues (as per the VMware Global Support Service top 10 list) from the best instructors in the industry. In this session you will learn how to start troubleshooting problems and what tools to use to troubleshoot issues relating to VMware Horizon. Areas to be covered will include automated pools (full clones, linked clones, and instant clones) as well as storage and network (PCoIP, RDP, Blast/Blast Extreme Experience).

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9386 - What’s new with Workspace ONE: Identity meets Mobility
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Users want simplicity. IT admins want security. With the integration of identity and Mobility, Workspace ONE is able to provide a single solution for both BYOD and Corp-owned devices to enable contextual experience based on user, device, app and location.


In this session, we will walk you through how an end user can use Workspace ONE to access web, mobile and remote apps via Single Sign-On and how an IT admin can have a single place to configure Authentication, Single Sign-On, Device Enrollment and Access Policies.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7870 - VMware's Solution Strategy on Mobility’s Evolution to Internet of Things into 2016 and Beyond
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Hear directly from VMware CTOs, mobility strategists and field principal on mobility evolution to IoT revolution into 2016 and beyond. The session will provide expert insight on how to recalibrate and map the emerging innovation trends on mobility and IoT to your existing enterprise End User Computing (EUC) and application rationalization strategies. The attendees will appreciate how business, IT and financial outcomes can be accelerated by tapping into tangible capabilities of mobility enabled IoT solutions that leverage the hybrid cloud platform. The potential generated by these solutions is capable of being tapped across various industry verticals – healthcare, financial services, retail, education, manufacturing, government and consumer packaged goods (CPG) creating an IoT revolution in days to come.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8938 - Limitless Learning: Leveraging VMware Technology to Provide a Digital Learning and Working Environment for Every Student and All Faculty and Staff
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Can you struggle to meet the needs of students, faculty and staff? Doessecurity keeps you awake at night? Did you know that education institutions use many different VMware technologies to accomplish the same or similar goals? Join a distinguished panel of VMware customers in a lively discussion of how they are delivering education and business solutionswithin their institutionsusing specific VMware technology. Attendees will walk away with a broader view of the possibilities of how to enable students and support faculty needs. They will be able to more closely align their current or developingbusiness and curriculumstrategy with specific VMware products that help address pain points, use cases, and goals. VMware Horizon, VMware App Volumes, VMware AirWatch, VMware Workspace ONE, VMware Virtual SAN, and partner technologies from NVIDIA and Teradici will be discussed alongside tips, tricks, and lessons learned along the way. Q&A will be a key feature, so come ready to join the debate

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7644R - Unify Endpoint Management Across Mobile and Desktop
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Laptops continue to be an integral part of how people work. However, management practices and tools for PC environments, including Chrome, Mac, and Windows, have traditionally been different than those for mobile environments, such as Android, iOS, and BlackBerry. Users can work between devices like never before, and IT needs to keep up. The fragmentation of administrative and maintenance processes has decreased IT productivity and led to inconsistent security policies, app delivery and reporting–until now. PC and mobile platforms are converging and IT administrators can now support all user endpoints, including laptops, with a unified endpoint management (UEM) from AirWatch.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8160r - Discover AirWatch: Enterprise Mobility Management
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Enterprise mobility is more than putting email on a smartphone; it packs the power to lift an enterprise to a competitive advantage. However, as the volume and variety of mobile devices surge, so do expectations among end users and line of business leaders to put these devices to work as tools for productivity and customer engagement. The emerging challenge for IT is to manage mobility in the enterprise, secure corporate data, and provide a management solution that is adaptable to changing business needs.

An effective enterprise mobility management (EMM) platform, like AirWatch, provides a seamless experience for users across multiple devices – delivering a secure workspace for your business-critical applications, making it safe for bring your own device (BYOD) environments, and providing a platform that can scale to serve your increasingly mobile workforce and customer base. Join AirWatch and CSC to dive into the capabilities of EMM and learn how it being deployed in enterprise use cases.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9395 - How Horizon 7 and Horizon Air Are Changing the Cost Economics of Virtual Desktop Delivery
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Virtual desktops have long demonstrated a lower TCO than physical desktops, but the savings were initially driven by reductions in operational costs: it was "pay more today to save over a lifetime." With the launch of VMware Horizon 6, that equation changed, and virtual desktops became the lowest capital-cost option, too. But we at VMware did not stand still: we relentlessly pursued further cost savings in both categories, while simultaneously driving up the business value obtained in deployment. In this session, we will describe the what and the how of the VMware cost reduction journey. Drawing on detailed analysis and the experience of real building business cases for customers that only market leadership offers, we will show how Horizon 7 and Horizon Air Hybrid Mode represent the new state of the art in desktop cost leadership.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8725 - Everything You Need to Know About Horizon Remote Desktop Services Hosted Applications (But Probably Do Not)
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Since their introduction in VMware Horizon 6, remote desktop services hosted applications have been a cornerstone capability for delivering desktops and applications of every type from a single unified platform. This year Horizon 7 provides a monumental leap forward for remote desktop services hosted applications, with new innovations in application layering, user profile management, administration, and monitoring. Moreover, with Blast Extreme, remote desktop services hosted applications and desktops get a remote experience upgrade that is optimized for mobile devices and works better across a variety of networks. This session will be of interest to administrators of all levels and expertise, including those who have watched remote desktop services hosted apps from the sidelines and are ready to jump in.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8853 - Taking Back the Desktop
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In the past few decades, we’ve seen an amazing shift in how computers are used in the workspace. They have gone from being a tool that supports a user menial tasks, to a personal resource that houses information shared with colleagues, friends and family. In many cases, enterprises have lost the ability to manage individual desktops and need to regain control before the worst happens. VMware Business Mobility and Enterprise Desktop products are designed to help organizations take back their desktops in a way that provides minimal impact on the end-user and maximum peace of mind for the organization. VMware training equips users at all levels with the skills and knowledge needed to deploy and manage these solutions. In this session, we will highlight the main features of the products including Horizon, AppsVolumes and AirWatch. We will help you understand how each fits into the organization. We’ll also include an overview of available training and certification programs that ensure the IT staff is trained and ready to take full advantage of mobility tools.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8346 - Modernizing and Mobilizing Retail IT
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Learn how The Secure Digital Workspace for Retail turns shoppers into buyers, transforms workflows and improves the retail experience across any computing environment, integrating identity, application, and enterprise mobility management to deliver a secure, unified workspace available at all times. This session will feature a live demo, and industry experts from Coca-Cola, Abercrombie and Fitch, and VMware.

Presenters.Name: Mark Dunkerley, The Coca-Cola Company (Bottling Investments Group)
Presenters.LastName: Mark Dunkerley, The Coca-Cola Company (Bottling Investments Group)

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8822 - Case Study: Large-Scale Deployment of VMware App Volumes and User Environment Manager for 10,000 Seats
PresentationDetailsList.Description: A case study that discusses the success story of an enterprise customer that has deployed VMware App Volumes and VMware User Environment Manager for a large-scale environment of 10,000 VMware Horizon desktops. The aim of this case study is to share the best practices, challenges, advantages, and limitations in deploying App Volumes and User Environment Manager and to help other customers who are exploring App Volumes and User Environment Manager in a large scale in terms of architecture design, recommendations, tips and tricks, standards, and considerations for packaging and managing user profiles in the virtual desktop infrastructure.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8521 - The Future of VMware Fusion and Workstation
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Fusion and VMware Workstation are the leading desktop virtualization software. Join us to find out the future of these products.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7678 - Real-World Examples Using App Volumes, User Environment Manager, Mirage, and vRealize Operations to Deliver Complete Desktop, App, and User Management and Monitoring
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The VMware end-user computing portfolio is composed of a rich set of products that help IT manage desktops, deliver apps, and much more. Join us in this customer panel session to hear from customers who are using technologies such as VMware App Volumes, VMware User Environment Manager, VMware Mirage, and VMware vRealize Operations to better manage their physical and virtual desktop and published application environments.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8605 - Next-Generation Mobile Productivity with Workspace ONE Apps
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In today consumer world, there is a mobile app for everything. Influenced by consumer technology, employees are demanding fast mobile access via work apps to effectively get work done on-the-go. The Workspace ONE Apps Suite provide a seamless and integrated app experience, giving users instant access to corporate email, calendar, contacts, files, browser, social and chat. Discover how to boost mobile productivity while upholding security and compliance standards with Workspace ONE.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7995 - Enterprise Mobility Automation using Software Defined Data Center (SDDC): Role-based Desktop and infrastructure provisioning
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Need to automate delivery of anytime, anywhere, any device access to various user personas within your organization? Look no further. Follow the footsteps of VMware practitioners from the Americas Professional Services Organization and End User Computing (EUC) R&D team to get real-life insight into how mobility and EUC uses cases can be successfully deployed and scaled using VMware's Horizon and SDDC automation platforms. This Reference Architecture (RA) covers the planning, designing, deployment and measurement process for successful Business and IT outcomes. Relevant to a variety of industry verticals but not limited to – Healthcare, Financial, Point-of-Sales (POS), Services, Hi-Tech, Manufacturing, Hospitality, and others.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9179 - Introducing Horizon Air Hybrid Mode: Low-Cost, Simplified Virtual Desktop and Application Deployment and Management
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Industry trends such as cloud, mobility, and BYO devices are pushing the boundaries of the end-user workspace beyond the traditional desktop. Organizations are actively looking to implement digital workspaces: the ability to allow end users a simple way to access all their corporate data and applications from any device in a secure way. Virtual desktops and applications play a big role in enabling this transformation, but remain complex and costly to deploy. VMware Horizon Air hybrid mode changes this by addressing the speed and ease with which IT administrators can deploy virtual desktops and applications while providing cost- and performance-optimized infrastructure for workloads that are deployed on the premises, in the cloud, or hybrid. We will take a look at how Horizon Air hybrid mode integrates virtual desktop, application, and other associated technologies; provides a unified, cloud-based management console; and offers a hybrid deployment model combining software-as-a-service (SaaS) benefits with on-premises benefits of compliance and performance. We will look at the technology components, explore sample use cases, take a sneak peek at the product, and discuss the technical details of the solution.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8345 - Mobilizing and Modernizing Government IT to Advance Missions: The Secure Digital Workspace for Government
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The widespread consumerization of mobile devices continues to have sweeping effects on today's work environment as productivity is no longer confined to on-premises devices and networks. As a result, organizations within both the private and public sectors are enabling mobile access to enterprise resources to not only improve employee productivity but also strengthen data security and streamline IT management. This new way of working—labeled the digital workspace—is beginning to creep into government workplaces. The digital workspace is revolutionizing citizen service delivery and mission outcomes when successfully deployed. At its core, the digital workspace for government is an end-user computing model that requires desktop and application virtualization as a means to enable anytime, anywhere access to government resources. Additionally, agencies with plans to enable access to data on mobile devices require an enterprise mobility management strategy. In this session, you will hear from agency leaders who have successfully implemented digital workspaces among their workforce and learn the key components of a government-ready digital workspace. With concentration on data security, compliance, and IT management, key topics include: - Designing a digital workspace framework to address employee mobility - Architecting a digital workspace for government across data centers, desktops, and devices - Increasing data security and compliance- Achieving continuity of operations for all employees - Modernizing desktop infrastructure to increase organizational agility and reduce management costs - Enabling secure remote access to any application on any device - Planning and deployment best practices Agencies will also discuss how their digital workspace environments measure against key performance indicators such as workforce productivity, service delivery, cost of operations, disaster recovery, cost avoidance, and data security.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9451-SPO - Preventing Attacks on Mobile Devices using AirWatch Integration with Palo Alto Networks
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
With the adoption of mobile platforms for business applications and data, the security requirements are expanding both in scope and in location. These issues are even more complicated when considering privacy concerns with BYOD. How do you inspect content, stop threats and while respecting the boundaries of end user privacy? Learn about how the Palo Alto Networks Next-Generation Security Platform delivers protection to mobile devices by using tight integration with AirWatch. This session will cover:
• Maintaining separation of business traffic and data
• Stopping threats such as exploits, malware and phishing attacks from reaching a mobile device
• Using threat intelligence to find infected mobile devices

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7797 - How to Manage Personal Settings with App Volumes and ThinApp
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Application delivery is a piece of cake with VMware ThinApp and VMware App Volumes, but the user profile issues remain. "How can I roam my personal application settings?" and "How can I maintain application settings when upgrading to Windows 10?" are still valid questions that we hear from a lot of customers. In this session you will learn how personal settings are stored with ThinApp and App Volumes and what you can do to manage those settings.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8392 - Untethered Yet Secure: Technical Deep Dive on Using Horizon FLEX to Manage VMware Workstation Player and VMware Fusion Pro
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Virtualization offers the promise of security and stability, walling the guest virtual machine off from the host OS and other virtual machines. Add a layer of administrator-managed corporate control, and you have a solution that works online and offline with reliable performance. This session will dig in on the security settings and communications model in VMware Horizon FLEX and offer best practices on infrastructure.

Presenters.Name: Eric Yueting Zhang, VMware Information Technology(China) Co. Ltd
Presenters.LastName: Eric Yueting Zhang, VMware Information Technology(China) Co. Ltd

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8648R - Architecting VSAN for Horizon the VCDX Way
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Horizon is a proven desktop virtualization solution that has been deployed around the world. Balancing the performance and cost of a storage solution for Horizon can be difficult and affects the overall return on investment. VMware Virtual Storage Area Network (VSAN) has provided architects with a new weapon in the battle for desktop virtualization. VSAN allows architects to design a low-cost, high-performance hybrid solution of solid state and spinning disks or all flash for the ultimate desktop performance. VSAN now includes features such as dedupe, compression, and metro clustering, which provides greater options to fit your use cases. Learn from two Double VMware Certified Design Experts on how to architect Horizon on a VSAN solution to provide the levels of performance your users need, with management simplicity that will keep your administrators happy and at a cost that will ensure your project will be a success.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8784-SPO - Architecting Highly Available, Scalabe and Resilient Enterprise Mobility & Desktop/Application Solutions
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Struggling with designing an End User Computing environment that gives you an always-on experience? Trouble understanding all the moving parts & determining what is critical and what is not? Come hear some of the industry's experts on how to design availability and resiliency into your end user computing solutions. They'll cover the common challenges seen in the industry in addition to talking about the business and technical drivers for highly available and resilient solutions. Next, we'll take a deep-dive into identifying the critical components of an EUC solution, including storage, network, etc. and methods to test availability ,resiliency and scale. Finally, the expert panel will share their best practices and real-world experiences on how to best get from zero-to-hero when architecture and deploying a resilient and scalable EUC infrastructure.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8745 - Under the Hood with Identity Manager and Office 365
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Deployment of Office 365 is accelerating in many enterprises today. Identity Manager can help make O365 deployment easier through federating between an on premises Active Directory environment and Azure Active Directory environment, and centralize access to Office 365 applications through Identity Manager or Workspace ONE. This session will detail the options to enable federation with Identity Manager and Azure AD, and how to publish Office 365 apps in a portal or the Workspace ONE apps.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7519 - Access Point: Advances in End-User Computing Remote Access
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In today's mobile workforce era, it has become increasingly important to deliver intuitive access to end-user computing resources while maintaining the strict security policies set out by an enterprise. This is a technical session in which we will be presenting advances and direction in VMware Access Point, the end-user computing virtual appliance remote access gateway.The session covers access security for VMware Horizon View, Horizon Air (DaaS), Horizon Air Hybrid-Mode, Identity Manager, and will briefly touch on AirWatch technologies.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9388 - Customer Panel: How Enterprises Are Using VMware Identity Manager to Enable Their Users to Be Productive on Any Device, Anywhere
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session, you'll hear directly from enterprise customers how they're using Vmware Identity Manager in Workspace ONE to power their diverse workforce. We'll cover their business challenges, why they chose Identity Manager, and best practices for success.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9394 - Horizon Air and Interconnecting the Clouds
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Take a deep dive into cloud networking, cloud exchange/network connects, and cloud authentication, including Azure Active Directory and Google OTP.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9139 - NSX and Horizon Reference Design: Secure End-User Computing
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This session is for the experienced end-user computing architect who wants to gain knowledge and insight into how VMware NSX amplifies the agility and security posture of a VMware Horizon View deployment. This session will begin at a high level, but will dive deep into the design and architecture nuances that are part of a successful micro-segmentation and network virtualization design within a Horizon infrastructure.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7864 - Protect the Edge: Secure IoT and Medical Devices
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Connected healthcare is a vision of a fully integrated system where technology provides real-time access to patient data and patient monitoring while inside the hospital and while the patient is at home. This vision is quickly becoming a reality. However, medical and IoT devices used for monitoring are creating new security vulnerabilities that need to be addressed from evolving threats. One of these threats, ransomware, has affected over 50% of all hospitals in the United States. Although the amount of money demanded in these attacks has been small, the resulting costs from system downtime have been astronomical. IoT and medical devices are well known to be vulnerable, and most manufacturers have not yet included robust security features in their design. Forrester Research has predicted that this year the healthcare industry will see a ransomware attack specifically from a medical device or wearable IoT device. Every medical device has an IT component, and almost all handle or store data. IoT devices are constantly feeding back data and information. These devices need to be managed, tracked, and updated on a regular basis. A large healthcare system can have well over 60 to 80 thousand of these devices ranging from beds, infusion pumps, and vital monitors to new web-enabled devices such as wearables or implantables. In addition, clinicians and patients now have multiple devices on their persons constantly accessing information and data. It is becoming increasing critical that new methods are needed for addressing these threats introduced by new technologies. In this session you will learn how VMware and AirWatch are securing the edge to help our customers safely accelerate toward the promise of a fully connected healthcare system while maintaining the privacy, security, and control of patient data.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9391 - Managing Windows in a Modern Mobile-Cloud Framework
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Windows 10 is poised to have a significant impact on organizations’ EUC strategy, creating a more secure, cost effective and unified computing environment with a better user experience. As organizations embrace this new OS, they expect a management solution with more agility and robustness than traditional PC lifecycle management tools that have proven to be fragmented, expensive, and restrictive to the users.

VMware AirWatch features a new – and more efficient – approach to Windows lifecycle management. The Unified Endpoint Management (UEM) platform across your desktop and mobile endpoints, now introduces a full set of Windows 10 capabilities enabling configuration management, security, and software and patch distribution. By combining the requirements of traditional PC lifecycle management and the modern Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) platform, VMware AirWatch reduces the costs and burden on your IT, and helps you smoothly transition to the most secure and productive Windows platform yet.
This session takes a deeper look into how Windows management evolved from a rigid PCLM approach to one offering a flexible, over-the-air configuration model. We will also look into the specific desktop management capabilities that VMware AirWatch has to offer.
This session provides an overview of how Windows management evolved from a rigid and disruptive PC-centric approach to one offering a flexible and light-touch model. It will also delve into the specific management technologies that Windows 10 introduces, as well as leveraging conventional Windows management tools that are in use today.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7560 - Four Unique Enterprise Customers Deployment of VMware Virtual SAN
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Different customers will take the stage for a panel discussion about their unique Virtual SAN (VSAN) use cases each meeting common outcomes including: cost efficient performance, storage convergence, reduced complexity, and increased scalability using Virtual SAN. One of the world largest health insurance company choose Virtual SAN as the software defined storage solution for their virtual desktop environment. Their environment consists of over 22,000 virtual desktops and over 1000 server virtual machines on 1.7 PB of storage capacity. The drivers for selecting Virtual SAN was improve operational efficiencies by leveraging Virtual SAN storage policy based management and increased end-user performance. A large North East Regional Bank is utilizing vSphere and Virtual SAN to meet their high availability needs to support their production environment. Removing vCenter and other third party management components from their production environment and onto a VSAN enabled vSphere management cluster, these critical tools are available for use if there is a production outage. VSAN delivers the shared storage capacity and performance that these demanding workloads require. This use case leverages the latest vSphere and VSAN 6.2 release to take advantage of all-flash, deduplication, compression, and the inherited redundancy. Additional redundancy within the datacenter is achieved by segregating the vSphere Cluster by fault domains. A global manufacturing company selected Virtual SAN as the Hyper Converged Infrastructure (HCI) storage solution for 1000+ remote offices. Additionally, their most recent implementation using VSAN enabled vSphere clusters in two larger distribution centers and leverage vSphere replication for bi-directional asynchronous replication to protect VSAN data at each location. A global financial services firm uses Virtual SAN enabled vSphere clusters for their Business Critical Applications. In addition, they deployed Horizon View on Virtual SAN to achieve low cost, high performance, and linear scalability of compute, memory, and storage resources for Virtual Desktop.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO8754 - Virtual SAN and Horizon: Designed for Simple, Powerful Virtual Desktops
PresentationDetailsList.Description: The “classic” view of virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) is fading as the data center converges and end-user computing diverges. The old capacity requirements and performance issues of VDI are disappearing thanks to the radically simple HCI and new storage innovations. In this session we'll look at common VDI misconceptions and how VDI reality is changing thanks to flash-optimized, scalable storage that delivers game-changing cost savings.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7888 - Why Siemens Uses High-Performance Desktops with VMware Horizon and Nvidia GRID vGPU
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Have you ever wondered if you could run your graphics-intensive applications such as Siemens NX and Siemens Team Center in your enterprise cloud? Would it perform the same as on your powerful workstation on your desk? 
Join this session and hear about the journey from 16 desktops in a cooling container to 2500+ virtual desktops and how Siemens transformed virtual clients from being just an extra desktop to a business-critical service using VMware Horizon View and Nvidia GRID to meet the demands of a global, anytime, anywhere workforce that is no longer tethered to location or hardware. Learn about the business drivers for why Siemens has high-performance visualized solutions for delivering standard 2D desktops and immersive 3D graphics for designers and researchers.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7613 - Ask the Expert: Everything You Want to Know About VMware End-User Computing
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
We have lined up a panel of end-user computing experts who are ready to answer all of your questions.

Bring your questions. Tell us what you want to do and where you would like to go.

Come and discuss with us the strategies for the road ahead.

You need to do it more quickly, more cheaply, and better. We want to help you get there.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9390 - Securing Against Cyber Attacks from Datacenter to Device
PresentationDetailsList.Description: As mission critical business workflows become more mobile, yesterday security protocols and measures have become inadequate. New and ever increasing cybersecurity threats have made comprehensive security from the device to the datacenter no longer “nice to have” but “mission critical”.Securing your digital workspace against cyber-attacks can be a daunting task. Organizations are looking to address user identity, application access, device posture, network security and threat intelligence for resources on-premise and/or in the cloud that balances enterprise security with consumer simplicity. Learn how VMware with VMware Workspace ONE including VMware Identity Manager, VMware AirWatch, VMware NSX and the Mobile Security Alliance protect user access while limiting access to corporate data in the event of a cyber-attack to deliver a comprehensive security strategy for any device, over any network to any cloud.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8648R - Architecting VSAN for Horizon the VCDX Way
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Horizon is a proven desktop virtualization solution that has been deployed around the world. Balancing the performance and cost of a storage solution for Horizon can be difficult and affects the overall return on investment. VMware Virtual Storage Area Network (VSAN) has provided architects with a new weapon in the battle for desktop virtualization. VSAN allows architects to design a low-cost, high-performance hybrid solution of solid state and spinning disks or all flash for the ultimate desktop performance. VSAN now includes features such as dedupe, compression, and metro clustering, which provides greater options to fit your use cases. Learn from two Double VMware Certified Design Experts on how to architect Horizon on a VSAN solution to provide the levels of performance your users need, with management simplicity that will keep your administrators happy and at a cost that will ensure your project will be a success.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8603 - Support the Complete Mobile App Management (MAM) Lifecycle with AirWatch
PresentationDetailsList.Description: AirWatch provides the most comprehensive Mobile App Management (MAM) platform for licensing, securing, configuring, deploying, and management of apps for mobile device platforms. IT can deploy native, hybrid or web apps via an enterprise app catalog. Join us to learn how the AirWatch platform, along with our extensive partner ecosystem, can help you solve all use cases across corporate owned and BYOD deployments to manage public and private mobile apps.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9610-SPO - Optimize Storage Infrastructure for Horizon Performance
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Storage has always been the Achilles heel of Virtual Desktop Infrastructure, often leading to unsuccessful deployments or ongoing user satisfaction issues. Architects are constrained by storage cost and sizing in their design considerations, and users are too frequently frustrated by slow performance and poor levels of availability. This session helps address the key storage challenges impacting Horizon, specifically: best practices on how to achieve high IOPS and low latency including using all flash storage, guidance to help deliver performance under all conditions, how to attain high levels of availability, and successfully scaling for future growth.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7611 - User Environment Manager 9: Do It Fast, Do It Right, Do It Big!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Managing user profiles and data has been an intricate part of the job for every IT admin for the last 20-plus years. In this session, we will show you how to quickly and efficiently deploy VMware User Environment Manager 9 to manage your user personas and data. We will cover the prerequisites for a successful production deployment and how you can grow the deployment from a few users to tens of thousands of users. We will demo all the latest features included in User Environment Manager 9 and how they can interact with VMware Horizon 7.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8670 - Your Digital Workspace: How to Plan, How to Start
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Organisations everywhere are focused on workplace transformation and what this means for the technologies they deploy and use for work. Many are looking to build plans or strategies, but struggling to connect their business and functional goals with the increasingly diverse set of technology options available to them. Others have plans for a digital workspace, but don't know how or where to start implementing them. We describe how VMware can help you overcome these challenges and get your workplace transformation projects back on track. Whether you are just beginning the journey, or just looking to your next steps in business mobility, BYO or desktop modernisation, our unique approaches to building and implementing plans will help.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7453 - Horizon for Linux Technical Deep Dive
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware continues to innovate and evolve, introducing Linux virtual desktops with VMware Horizon. Come and join our session as we take you on a technical deep dive for delivering Linux to the enterprise. Learn best practices and the most common use cases for using Linux desktops with Horizon 7. We will discuss the architecture that makes Linux VDI possible, including the Blast Extreme protocol, multiple Linux distributions, and support for 3D workloads with vGPU and vDGA.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7644R - Unify Endpoint Management Across Mobile and Desktop
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Laptops continue to be an integral part of how people work. However, management practices and tools for PC environments, including Chrome, Mac, and Windows, have traditionally been different than those for mobile environments, such as Android, iOS, and BlackBerry. Users can work between devices like never before, and IT needs to keep up. The fragmentation of administrative and maintenance processes has decreased IT productivity and led to inconsistent security policies, app delivery and reporting–until now. PC and mobile platforms are converging and IT administrators can now support all user endpoints, including laptops, with a unified endpoint management (UEM) from AirWatch.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8441 - End-to-End Security for End-User Computing
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Have recent data breaches kept you up at night? Are you worried about how to protect your applications and virtual desktops from zero-day exploits? In this session, hear from industry end-user computing experts on the security challenges that taunt virtualization, desktop, and application administrators today. These same experts will share their experience on best practices and real-world solutions used to secure the end-user computing elements from the perimeter to the virtual machine/desktop and everything in between. Finally, we will deep dive into the benefits and architecture of integrating VMware NSX and other industry-leading solutions to build a comprehensive, defense-in-depth security architecture for your end-user computing environment.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7856 - Solve Your Citrix Problems with VMware Technologies
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Are you planning a migration off Citrix XenApp or XenDesktop? Or looking for ways to make them run as well as you thought they should? Then this is the session for you. Come hear from the architect of the VMware Citrix migration and enhancement strategies as he explains how key VMware technologies such as VMware Horizon, VMware App Volumes, Instant Clone, and VMware NSX can help. We will dive deep on how to evaluate the state of the Citrix environment, assess project requirements, and review real-world scenarios. By the end of the session you will know all about the best practices, tools, and services available to ensure your project is a complete success. Come learn how VMware technologies can help solve your Citrix problems.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9992 - Ask the Experts: Practical Tips and Tricks to Help You Succeed in EUC
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Boost your End-User Computing (EUC) knowledge by attending this power panel. Eight experts will be on hand to give you their latest tips and tricks and to answeryourquestions about EUC deployments. Bring your notepads and your toughest questions! EUC Champions is an Expert Program designed with the help of several EUC experts in the community to provide a platform for the EUC expert community and VMware EUC product groups to exchange ideas and plans. Leverage decades of experience this panel brings to you with moderator Matt Heldstab and panelists Earl Gay, Jason Langer, Sean Massey, and Rob Beekmans.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9922-SPO - Cisco HyperFlex Systems: Next Generation Hyperconvergence
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Please join us to explore one of the hottest topics in IT, hyperconverged infrastructure, and learn how simplicity is the key to happiness with Cisco HyperFlex Systems. With a single point of management through VMware vCenter, Cisco HyperFlex Systems is a powerful solution that simple and easy for VMware customers to operate and scale. In this session, learn how Cisco has delivered complete hyperconvergence, with end-to-end, software-defined infrastructure that eliminates the compromises found in first-generation products. We will introduce HyperFlex in-depth: with a tour of its integrated network fabric, powerful data optimization, enterprise storage management features and unified management.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8437 - Workspace ONE’s Secure App Token System (SATS) for Mobile Single Sign-On explained
PresentationDetailsList.Description: With Workspace One with Identity Manager, VMware released the industry first Secure App Token System, enabling seamless, yet secure access for end users to their business apps. While no requirement of special SDK or wrapping technology, Workspace ONE with VMware Identity Manager and AirWatch combine to create a seamless user experience across desktop, web, and mobile. Single sign-on to public mobile apps is achieved using the patent pending Secure App Token System (SATS) that establishes trust between the user, device, application, and the enterprise.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8589 - Best Practices for Effectively Planning and Implementing BYOD Programs
PresentationDetailsList.Description: With the consumerization of IT and proliferation of mobile devices, most organizations either support or are planning to implement a BYOD program. An effective program can increase employee engagement, boost mobile productivity while reducing costs. The planning process requires policy, infrastructure and implementation considerations to ensure security, compliance, data loss prevention, privacy and implementation readiness. Join us to learn about BYOD best practices based on our experience assisting thousands of customers.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9393 - Real-time Endpoint Visibility and Control with VMware TrustPoint
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Recent history has shown that multiple high profile security breaches occurred at the endpoint level due to opportunistic and malicious attackers taking advantage of low endpoint security hygiene to exploit organizations. In this session, you will learn common security risks in the digital workspace, and how VMware TrustPoint can help organizations raise the bar on security hygiene to reduce threats while being able to detect and remediate security breaches in seconds.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9469-SPO - Scale, Efficiency and Data Management for EUC solutions with NetApp
PresentationDetailsList.Description: End User Computing imposes a unique set of requirements on IT, especially around infrastructure and data management. These requirements are often dynamic, and place new demands on the storage platform. Choosing the appropriate storage as the foundation for your EUC solution can be an extremely difficult decision, and one that can spell success or disaster. This session will look at the different desktop delivery requirements of VMware's Horizon, Horizon DaaS and App Volumes products, the challenges IT must address for successful deployment, and the capabilities of NetApp AFF and SolidFire storage platforms to meet customers’ ever demanding storage needs. Several storage architectures tailored for specific VMware solutions will be discussed, along with best practices for deployment and ongoing operation. You’ll get the guidance you need to design a flexible EUC infrastructure that can be implemented quickly, with guaranteed performance, and scale to meet future needs.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9217 - On-Premises Workloads with Cloud-Based Management: Technical Deep Dive into Horizon Air Hybrid Mode
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Benefits of desktop virtualization are clear, and adoption is on the rise with the move to cloud, mobility, and BYO devices. But organizations are looking for smarter solutions that are easier to deploy, are cost effective, and allow flexibility of deployment. What is desired is an approach that brings the benefits of the cloud, such as software as a service (SaaS), coupled with infrastructure as a service (IaaS) for ease of infrastructure management. VMware Horizon Air hybrid mode does just that by delivering a hybrid cloud software service hosted by VMware, which enables organizations to deliver virtual desktops and manage applications from on-premises infrastructure, while centrally managing it all from the cloud. The advantage of this solution is that the desktop capacity resides in the customers' data center (similar to Horizon 7), but all of the administration will be done from the cloud (like Horizon Air). This merges the best of both, the cloud and on the premises, and enables customers to take advantage of a cloud-based SaaS experience without worrying about network connectivity or data compliance. We will take a closer look at the product architecture, see the product setup and deployment in action, and explore how the service can be used by organizations for typical use cases.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7443r - How did VMware IT Achieve a Non-Disruptive Disaster Recovery Test in 90 Minutes for 900 Terabytes of Storage and 2000 Production Virtual Machines?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware IT team achieved a non-disruptive disaster recovery (DR) test failover for 900 terabytes of storage and over 2000 production virtual machines in 90 minutes using VMware Site Recovery Manager (SRM), VMware NSX and VMware Horizon View. Simplified DR is one of the biggest driving factors for virtualizing multi-tier applications. Most enterprises have struggled to meet business DR requirements due to the cost, effort and down time involved in implementation and testing. VMware IT team developed a DR approach with the goals of shortening the Recovery Time Objective (RTO) and allowing non-disruptive DR testing that includes application functionality validation. We will discuss the architecture of VMware IT non-disruptive DR solution using SRM, how VMware NSX can be used to create an isolated copy of the production network topology for DR testing and the implementation of VMware View for end-user connectivity to the isolated DR test network. This session will also discuss the testing methodology and advanced configurations used to achieve the DR testing with a shortened RTO.

Presenters.Name: Mohammed Raffic Kajamoideen, VMware Software India Ltd
Presenters.LastName: Mohammed Raffic Kajamoideen, VMware Software India Ltd

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9160 - Secure Digital Workspace of the Future: Embracing the Opportunities Presented by Enterprise Mobility in Financial Services
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In recent years, there has been a shift in the way financial institutions operate. Smartphones, tablets, and laptops are replacing the traditional desktop, as remote workers, roaming branch staff, and "road warriors" redefine the workspace. Employees expect seamless access to information anywhere, anytime on a device of their choice in order to be productive and engaged. In contrast, IT organizations have to ensure that the devices, applications, and data are securely managed, whether it is in the cloud or on the premises, and deliver on those goals by providing an infrastructure that is scalable, secure, efficient, and cost effective. In this session/panel discussion, leading banks and financial institutions will discuss how they are embracing new initiatives such as bring your own (BYO) and mobility management securely while streamlining and reducing the cost of managing and delivering both modern and legacy applications.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8160 - Discover AirWatch: Enterprise Mobility Management
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Enterprise mobility is more than putting email on a smartphone; it packs the power to lift an enterprise to a competitive advantage. However, as the volume and variety of mobile devices surge, so do expectations among end users and line of business leaders to put these devices to work as tools for productivity and customer engagement. The emerging challenge for IT is to manage mobility in the enterprise, secure corporate data, and provide a management solution that is adaptable to changing business needs.

An effective enterprise mobility management (EMM) platform, like AirWatch, provides a seamless experience for users across multiple devices – delivering a secure workspace for your business-critical applications, making it safe for bring your own device (BYOD) environments, and providing a platform that can scale to serve your increasingly mobile workforce and customer base. Join AirWatch and CSC to dive into the capabilities of EMM and learn how it being deployed in enterprise use cases.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9970-SPO - 0-70 with Horizon 7
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Quickly providing secure access to users is a challenge for most every organization. See how CDW helped a customer leverage the VMware Horizon platform to onboard and support 70 interns in less than a week. From pre-sales consultation all the way through to implementation, CDW expertise and partnership with VMware helped the customer meet their initial goals and then scale it to maximize the impact to the organization.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8990 - CSC Hyper-Productive Digital Workplace
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Younger workers have grown up immersed in digital technology. As they continue to join the workforce, they bring digital expectations. They demand the ability to work with smartphones, cloud computing, big data analytics and social media — in effect, a consumerized experience with enterprise information. And why shouldn’t they? With these services we can build a modern, digital workplace, one in which workers can easily get the information they need to perform their jobs with speed, efficiency and effectiveness, regardless of the information’s location, format or underlying technology. In this session, CSC will review why many organizations struggle to deliver the digital workplace and how CSC leverages VMware solutions like Horizon Air and AirWatch in their MyWorkStyle services to deliver a modern digital workplace that simplifies access to information, enables a collaborative experience and enables end users including accelerating the adoption of Windows 10.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7601R - Advances in Remote Display Protocol Technology with VMware Blast Extreme
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Learn about the advances in remote protocol technology with Blast Extreme. This technical session will provide a technical deep dive of the Blast Extreme protocol, Blast Extreme optimization with graphics technology partners (Intel, Nvidia, and AMD), and resourceful tips for fine-tuning various GPO parameters to deliver the best user experience in both LAN and WAN environments. This session will also compare and contrast performance of the Blast Extreme protocol and PCoIP.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC8584 - vRealize Operations: The Authoritative Source for Monitoring and Reporting for Horizon and Citrix XenApp Deployments on vSphere
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Do you require a deeper understanding of what is happening inside your VMware Horizon or Citrix environments?  Do you want to eliminate finger pointing and reduce time taken to resolve issues?   VMware vRealize Operations for Horizon and Published Applications is able to collect detailed information from both Horizon and Citrix (XenApp/XenDesktop) environments.  In this session we will cover architecture, capabilities, troubleshooting, and an overview of the dashboards.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9389 - What Is VMware Workspace ONE?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: IT organizations around the world are transforming to a Digital Workspace allowing employees flexibility to work from anywhere. Employees are demanding the tools to access any app on any device for business productivity. With the rise in bring your own device programs, the tools provided by enterprises must promise an amazing user experience while protecting sensitive business data. Learn how Workspace ONE unifies the worlds of Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM), Identity & Access Management (IAM) and VDI to deliver on IT promise.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC7800 - Deliver a Digital Clinical Workspace: Healthcare Customer Panel
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
Healthcare IT is rapidly escaping the basement. A digital clinical workspace is driving physician productivity, patient engagement, and satisfaction and increasingly becoming critical in hiring and competitive differentiation.

Our healthcare panel will discuss why and how their transformations are impacting care delivery and patient experience and opening new opportunities for innovation.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: STO7443 - How did VMware IT Achieve a Non-Disruptive Disaster Recovery Test in 90 Minutes for 900 Terabytes of Storage and 2000 Production Virtual Machines?
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware IT team achieved a non-disruptive disaster recovery (DR) test failover for 900 terabytes of storage and over 2000 production virtual machines in 90 minutes using VMware Site Recovery Manager (SRM), VMware NSX and VMware Horizon View. Simplified DR is one of the biggest driving factors for virtualizing multi-tier applications. Most enterprises have struggled to meet business DR requirements due to the cost, effort and down time involved in implementation and testing. VMware IT team developed a DR approach with the goals of shortening the Recovery Time Objective (RTO) and allowing non-disruptive DR testing that includes application functionality validation. We will discuss the architecture of VMware IT non-disruptive DR solution using SRM, how VMware NSX can be used to create an isolated copy of the production network topology for DR testing and the implementation of VMware View for end-user connectivity to the isolated DR test network. This session will also discuss the testing methodology and advanced configurations used to achieve the DR testing with a shortened RTO.

Presenters.Name: Mohammed Raffic Kajamoideen, VMware Software India Ltd
Presenters.LastName: Mohammed Raffic Kajamoideen, VMware Software India Ltd

PresentationDetailsList.Name: EUC9387 - Deployment Best Practices for VMware Identity Manager
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware Workspace ONE combines identity and mobility management to provide frictionless and secure access to all the apps and data employees need to work, wherever, whenever and from whatever device they choose. Underpinning Workspace ONE is VMware Identity Manager, an identity management solution for the mobile cloud era that delivers on consumer-simple expectations like one-touch access to nearly any app, from any device. As organizations look to deploy Workspace ONE and Identity Manager, it's important to understand the deployment best practices to ensure success of your implementation and support for your toughest use cases.
